title: In Search of Famine
screenings: Pictureville Cinema, Sun 3 Nov 16:00, Vue Screen 11, Mon 4 Nov 17:30
info: Mrinal Sen | India | 1981 | 155 minutes | Bengali with English subtitles
description: A self-reflexive meditation on filmmaking, director Mrinal Sen explores the haunting legacy of the 1943 Bengal famine that resulted in the deaths of at least three million people. The story follows a film crew that arrives in a small village in an attempt to make a film on the Bengal famine. Smita Patil delivers a mesmerising performance as a young actress grappling with the blurred lines between art and reality. This is one of the great statements on film making, comparable to Kiarostami’s Life, and Nothing More (1990) and Wenders’ The State of Things (1982).
strand: LIFF SPOTLIGHT – Smita Patil: Spice and Fire
